newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-INJURED HIERRO MISSES SPAIN'S GAME WITH YUGOSLAVIA.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-INJURED HIERRO MISSES SPAIN'S GAME WITH YUGOSLAVIA.

text.p: Spanish midfielder Fernando Hierro said on Thursday he would miss Saturday's World Cup qualifier against Yugoslavia due to a knee injury.
"I'm still bothered by it -- it would be premature to play on Saturday," said Hierro, who suffered the injury in last weekend's Real Madrid-Barcelona clash.
Barcelona's Josep Guardiola or Miguel Angel Nadal are the most likely replacements for Hierro, an instant first choice for Spain for the past six years.
Spanish manager Javier Clemente had already been forced to call up uncapped Deportivo Coruna midfielder Armando Alvarez to replace injured playmaker Jose Luis Caminero.
However, Athletic Bilbao's Julen Guerrero, who has been suffering from a leg injury, has been passed fit.
Yugoslavia also have injury worries with striker Predrag Mijatovic and set-piece specialist Milinko Pantic -- both of whom play in the Spanish league -- in doubt.
